details.title: 'Looking forward': Minutes before landing, Donald Trump tweets in Hindi
details.content:
Ahead of his arrival in Gujarat's Ahmedabad, US President Donald Trump tweets - 'We are on our away. Looking Forward for our visit.'

हम भारत आने के लिए तत्पर हैं । हम रास्ते में हैँ, कुछ ही घंटों में हम सबसे मिलेंगे!

— Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) February 24, 2020

details.title: Passage to India: US President Donald Trump ready for warm embrace, adulation
details.content: Donald Trump is expected to receive a warm embrace from the ideologically aligned and hug-loving Prime Minister Narendra Modi, complete with a massive rally soon after his arrival Monday and then a sunset visit to the Taj Mahal. (READ MORE)

details.title: PM Modi reaches Ahmedabad to welcome Donald Trump
details.content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has arrived in Ahmedabad to welcome US President Trump who is expected to arrive by 11.30.

details.title: Namaste Trump: Preparations in full swing for Trump-Modi's joint address at Motera Stadium
details.content: Before the 'Namaste Trump' event, cultural events will be held at the 1.10-lakh seating capacity stadium, for which several artists, including well-known singer Kailash Kher, have been invited. (READ MORE)

details.title: Millions of people, dance, music: Stage is set for Donald Trump's arrival
details.content:
Gujarat: People form queues outside Motera Stadium in Ahmedabad, gather in the vicinity and occupy seats at the stadium ahead of 'Namaste Trump' event here today. pic.twitter.com/HzC34bXRJU

— ANI (@ANI) February 24, 2020

details.title: India eager to welcome Trump: PM Modi tweets
details.content:
India awaits your arrival @POTUS @realDonaldTrump!

Your visit is definitely going to further strengthen the friendship between our nations.

See you very soon in Ahmedabad. https://t.co/dNPInPg03i

— Narendra Modi (@narendramodi) February 24, 2020

details.title: Donald Trump, Obama, Bush and more: Who are the seven US Presidents who visited India?
details.content: Barack Obama, a Democrat, is the only president to have visited India twice. (READ MORE)

details.title: Grand cultural welcome for Trump at Motera Stadium
details.content:
#WATCH Gujarat: A group of dancers performing at Motera Stadium in Ahmedabad, ahead of the arrival of US President Donald Trump&First Lady Melania Trump. pic.twitter.com/b28Ts66IDF

— ANI (@ANI) February 24, 2020

details.title: Khaman, Broccoli samosa: This is what Donald Trump has on his menu
details.content: Trump will get a taste of Gujarati cuisine during their short stay in the city, said chef Suresh Khanna of the Fortune Landmark hotel. (READ MORE)

details.title: A look at US President Donald Trump's itinerary
details.content:
#IndiaWelcomesTrump | Minutes before US President's arrival in India, here is a look at his itinerary for the next two days from visiting the #SabarmatiAshram to meeting President Ram Nath Kovind.#NamasteTrump #TrumpInIndia #TrumpModiMeet

Read more: https://t.co/LIIYHHFLla pic.twitter.com/yO5JTq9T6K

— The New Indian Express (@NewIndianXpress) February 24, 2020

details.title: Donald Trump’s 'Namaste Mahatma' moment today
details.content: According to sources, the US president will be gifted a spinning wheel, two books on Mahatma Gandhi and a portrait of the Father of the Nation during his visit to the Sabarmati Ashram, which served as Gandhi’s home during the freedom struggle. (READ MORE)

details.title: READ OPINION: Trump, triumphalism and trade tantrums
details.content: Trump’s articulation of what is often referred to as a strategic relationship rides a distinctly bipolar, rant and rave beat. ‘India has been very bad but I like Modi’. There is pop sociology, pop economics, a reasonable pause and pop psychology, peppered with tirades on trade deficit, punctuated by his go-to phrases ‘tremendous’ and ‘very bad’. Our columnist Shankkar Aiyar on Trump, triumphalism and trade tantrums as the US President makes his visit. (READ MORE)

details.title: 'Athithi Devo Bhav!': PM Modi replies to Trump's Hindi tweet
details.content:
अतिथि देवो भव: https://t.co/mpccRkEJCE

— Narendra Modi (@narendramodi) February 24, 2020

details.title: Namaste Trump: US President and First Lady Melania land in Ahmedabad
details.content: Donald Trump the seventh US President to visit India while in office.

details.title: BCCI President Sourav Ganguly, Secretary Jay Shah reach Motera Stadium for grand fucntion
PM Narendra Modi reaches Ahmedabad airport to receive Trump
details.content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi arrives at Ahmedabad airport to receive US President Donald Trump and the First Lady.

details.title: 'Motera will be loudest stadium in world today.'
details.content:
Motera set to transform into the loudest stadium in the world for today!

The excitement in the air is palpable as the crowd builds up inside Motera awaiting PM @narendramodi and welcome President @realDonaldTrump & @FLOTUS for #NamasteTrump pic.twitter.com/4Pw3SL2mIj

— Raveesh Kumar (@MEAIndia) February 24, 2020

details.title: Trump, First Lady land in India; PM Modi gives a hug
details.content: PM Narendra Modi personally received the US first couple and hugged President Trump as he welcomed him.

details.title: Donald Trump en route Sabarmati Ashram
details.content: After being greeted by PM Narendra Modi, US President Donald Trump leaves for Sabarmati Ashram from the airport. This is the first time an incumbent American president will be visitng the ashram. The stop at Sabarmati en route Motera, where the Namaste Trump event will be held, was confirmed only on Sunday. The ashram has seen high-profile guests in the past including Queen Elizabeth, Chinese President XI Jingping, the Dalai Lama and Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe.

details.title: Dancers, Singers give Donald, Melania Trump a colourful welcome
details.content: Several people lined the road US President's cavalcade was travelling to giv a colourful welcome to the PLOTUS and FLOTUS.

details.title: Welcome to India: PM Modi took to Twitter to welcome US President Donald Trump
details.content: (Photo | Narendra Modi Twitter)

details.title: US President Donald Trump arrives at Gandhi Ashram
details.content: This is the first time an incumbent American president is visitng the Ashram.

details.title: POTUS, FLOTUS and Modi pay respects to Mahatma Gandhi at Sabarmati Ashram
details.content:
US President Donald Trump, First Lady Melania Trump, and PM Narendra Modi pay tribute to Mahatma Gandhi at Sabarmati Ashram

अमेरिकी राष्ट्रपति @realDonaldTrump साबरमती आश्रम पहुंचे। राष्ट्रपिता महात्मा गांधी को नमन किया। #NamasteyTrump #NamasteTrump pic.twitter.com/B088atKMl7

— Prasar Bharati News Services (@PBNS_India) February 24, 2020

details.title: Gandhi Ashram visit: Donald, Melania spin charkha, sign visitors' book
details.content:
As #India with PM @narendramodi celebrates #Gandhi150, US President Donald Trump @POTUS & First Lady Melania Trump @FLOTUS pay tribute to #MahatmaGandhi at #SabarmatiAshram. #IndiaWelcomesTrump #NamasteyTrump #TrumpInIndia pic.twitter.com/crxcteWy7Z

— PIB India (@PIB_India) February 24, 2020
At Gandhi Ashram, the Trumps tried to spin the 'charkha'. They also signed the visitors' book. They spent around 15 minutes in the Ashram and were accompanied by PM Narendra Modi.

details.title: Donald Trump heads to Motera Cricket stadium for 'Namaste Trump'
details.content: The authorities believe that between one to two lakh people are expected to line up along the 22-km route of the roadshow by Modi and Trump from the airport to the Motera cricket stadium, which is said to be the world's largest.

details.title: Much to be gained by India-US friendhsip: Tweets Nikki Haley
details.content:
Proud to see @realDonaldTrump and @FLOTUS going to India. The US and India are the two largest democracies in the world and share many values. There is much to be gained by the friendship of @narendramodi and @realDonaldTrump. #USPride #IndiaPride

— Nikki Haley (@NikkiHaley) February 23, 2020

details.title: From Namaste Trump to Taj Mahal visit, here's a look at US Prez's jam-packed schedule
details.content: Donald Trump's participation at the 'Namaste Trump' event is set at around 1.00 pm where he will address a mammoth crowd of more than 100,000 people at the Motera Stadium in the city. (READ MORE)

details.title: 'Thank you for a great visit': Trump thanks PM Modi
details.content: Visitors' book signed by US President Donald Trump at Gandhi Ashram. (Photo | PIB Twitter)

details.title: En route Motera: Trump heads to 'world's largest stadium'
details.content: The Sardar Patel Stadium also called the Motera Stadium was made in 1982 with a seating capacity of 49,000 at the time of construction, which has now been increased. The stadium will officially open for business today when US President Donald Trump inaugurates the venue. (READ MORE)

details.title: Donald Trump arrives at Motera Cricket stadium
details.content: PM Modi, Donald Trump arrive at Motera after 22 km roadshow.

details.title: 'Electric atmosphere': PMO tweets ahead of mega Namaste Trump event
details.content:
Electric Atmosphere at Motera Stadium as people eagerly wait to welcome President @realDonaldTrump #NamasteTrump pic.twitter.com/9VyxlynZWU

— PMO India (@PMOIndia) February 24, 2020

details.title: 'Never seen anything like this': White House Director of Social Media tweets photos
details.content:
In motorcade en route to the stadium. I’ve never seen anything like this. Unbelievable!!!! #NamasteTrump pic.twitter.com/EwFm3hZjgc

— Dan Scavino Jr.🇺🇸 (@Scavino45) February 24, 2020
Dan Scavino, White House Director of Social Media, who is also Assistant to Donald Trump, tweeted photographs of people who lined up to welcome the US President.

details.title: US President had a 'peaceful' experience at Gandhi Ashram
details.content: Sabarmati Ashram Trustee, Kartikeya Sarabhai said that the 'US President was happy to visit the Ashram. While leaving he said that it was a very peaceful experience and appreciated the simple living style of Gandhi ji.'

details.title: India-US ties have strengthened: PM Modi at 'Namaste Trump'
details.content: PM Narendra Modi welcomed President Donald Trump at Motera cricket stadium and started the 'Namaste Trump' event. India-US relations are no longer just another partnership. It is a far greater and closer relationship. One is 'land of the free' the other believes the world is one family, said PM Modi.

details.title: 'Great honour to be here': US President Donald Trump
details.content:
'Five months ago the United States welcomed your great Prime Minister at a giant football stadium in Texas and today India welcomes us at the world's largest cricket stadium right here in Ahmedabad. It is a great honour.' said Donald Trump as he began his Namaste Modi address.

(Photo | AP)

details.title: Trump praises Indian films, says 'Bollywood a thriving industry'
details.content: Donald Trump began his address at the Motera stadium with a Namaste. Praising the Indian film industry, the US President said he was here to cherish shared culture. 'All over the planet people take great joy in watching Bollywood films, bhangra, and classic films like DDLJ and Sholay. You cheer on great cricketers like Sachin Tendulkar and Virat Kohli. You have always stood as strong as one nation. Your unity is an inspiration to the world.' said Trump.

details.title: Hardwork can accomplish anything: Trump praises Modi's rise from 'chai-waala' to PM
details.content: Donald Trump was all praises about PM Modi. Calling him a friend, US President said Modi was not just the pride of Gujarat, but India. 'You are living proof that with hard work and devotion, Indians can accomplish anything they want.' said Trump in his address.

details.title: Over 3 billion worth military deal to be signed: Donald Trump
details.content: 'US looks forward to providing India with some of the best and most feared military equipment on the planet. We make the best and we are dealing now with India. More than USD 3 billion worth deal will be inked with India tomorrow. Together we will defend our sovereignty and security,' announced US President.

details.title: With Rolling Stones' 'You can't always get what you want' in the background, Trump, Modi leave for Agra
details.content: (Photo| AP)

details.title: WATCH| Trump gets Modi-fied in India
Clashes erupt in Delhi ahead of Trump's visit
details.content:
Ahead of Trump arrival in Delhi, violent clashes broke out between groups of pro and anti-CAA protesters. Several shops and vehicles were set ablaze in north-east Delhi's Maujpur area. The police and paramilitary forces resorted to firing tear gas to disperse the crowd.

Meanwhile, Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal has appealed for peace.

details.title: Here's what went into the grand welcome for President Trump
details.content:
• Police personnel deployed: around 70000
  • Water used to wash roads: 15000 litres
  • People in attendance: around 90000
  • Artists from various states: 2800
  • Largest contingent: 12 (jammu and kashmir)
  • Rooms for artists: 150-175
  • AMTS buses used: 87
  • Private buses: Around 170
  • Total cost incurred: Over 2.5 crore

details.title: Trump tweets again in Hindi
details.content:
प्रथम महिला और मैं इस देश के हर नागरिक को एक सन्देश देने के लिए दुनिया का 8000 मील का चक्कर लगा कर यहां आये हैं l अमेरिका भारत को  प्रेम करता है - अमेरिका भारत का सम्मान करता है - और
अमरीका के लोग हमेशा भारत के लोगों के सच्चे और निष्ठावान दोस्त रहेंगे l https://t.co/1yOmQOEnXE

— Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) February 24, 2020

Taj Mahal inspires me, writes Trump
Trump lands in Delhi
details.content: Amid violent clashes, Donald Trump and First Lady Melania Trump have landed in Delhi. (Photo | Shekhar Yadav, EPS)
